class_notes:
Same as HIST 396W 1.
Course Topic: Cooking with Shakespeare- Shakespeare's plays include banquets, tavern meals, and references to newly traded herbs, spices, and exotic commodities.  We will read and write about food practices in Shakespeare's time and enjoy hands-on workshops. In our asynchronous classes, we will watch podcasts and films related to Tudor farming, kitchens, feasts, and times of famine. Students with kitchens will also cook! (alternative assignments available).
course_description: Special topics in the study of Shakespeare. May include historical approaches, thematic emphases, performance studies, etc.
sections: Class Nbr: 2316, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MTWThF 11a-12:30p, Instructor: S. Cavanagh, Status: Open
